N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 576.1 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) The purpose of
these regulations is to establish standards pertaining to payments made by
government agencies pursuant to title 11 of article 5 of the Social Services

Law for services provided to residents of residential treatment facilities for
children and youth licensed by the Office of Mental Health in accordance with
the provisions of Part 584 of this Title. (b) In order to be eligible for payments
pursuant to title 11 of article 5 of the Social Services Law, a residential
treatment facility for children and youth must comply with the requirements of
the Mental Hygiene Law, this Title, 18 NYCRR, and title XIX of the Social

Security Act as identified in section
502.2
(c) of this

Title, applicable to inpatient psychiatric services for individuals under age
21. (c) The Medical Assistance

Program in New York State is administered by the New York State Department of

Social Services by and through local social services districts in cooperation
with various State agencies including the Office of Mental Health; and by the

New York State Department of Social Services by and through various State
agencies, including the Office of Mental Health. (d) The standards for payment established by
these regulations are intended to limit residential treatment facilities for
children and youth eligible for payment to those that meet State and Federal
requirements and to limit days eligible for payment to those on which services
are rendered or for which a bed has been appropriately reserved. Notes
